alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Butler (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 18 at 7:54AM EST until February 19 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Beaver and Butler. Portions of the northern panhandle of West Virginia, including the following county, Hancock. * WHEN...Until 130 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 753 AM EST, Runoff from last nights rain, snow melt, and local ice jams are causing small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cranberry, Weirton, Butler, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Monaca, Economy, Ellwood City, Ambridge, Homeacre-Lyndora, New Brighton, Shanor-Northvue, Beaver, Baden, Meridian, Zelienople, Rochester, Ohioville, Harmony Township and Meadowood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
